lines.text: [first lines]

Long after the Indian and the white man were at peace, small bands of renegade Indians were organized by unscrupulous white men. Pioneers coming west were murdered and their valuables stolen. These Indians traded stolen goods for the white man's whiskey. And as soon as they drank it, they wanted more. While the real criminals counted their profits and encouraged the Indians to more massacres, Americans were dying all along the frontier... and for no reason, save the ruthless greed of a few white traders.
[smoke signals are seen near Judge Harrison's ranch house]
The Indians are on the warpath! Now listen, Gray Eagle, I want you to get the horses together and load them with everything they can carry... what are you grinning at me like that for?
Not necessary to leave, Judge. Smoke signal, not war signal. It is message from friends.
From friends? Whose friends... not yours, I hope. Those murdering drunken Indians who kill everybody they see, why I...
Not red men, Judge... white men scouts. He of the great bullwhip; he of the hairy face!
You mean Bob Foster and Jake Jones?
Really? Are you sure?
Well how'd they get here so fast?
[more smoke signals billow above the ridge]
He say, "Will arrive suppertime with much hunger!"
[Jake is sending smoke signals]
Aw, the dad-busted wind! Keeps blowin' the smoke right in my face. Say, Bob, why don't you finish the message? I'm plumb wore all out.
Haven't got time, Jake - gotta finish shavin'. Don't want to look like a tramp with these whiskers on my face. 'Course on some people it might look good.
[glances at the bearded Jones]
I don't know any of *those* people.
Something ought to be done with Gray Eagle. If he ever finds out the whiskey is made here...
What are you going to do about setting up this Indian?
How much pay?
[The sheriff gives Longknife a pint of whiskey]
Small bottle - big job. No.
That's just a starter. You do this job right - get the marshal, his deputy and throw in Gray Eagle - and you'll have all the whiskey you can drink.
You get the dog-gonedest hunches, but I'd wish you'd quit playing dead. You want my whiskers to turn white like Santa Claus's?
Why, it might give you a little dignity.
Sheriff Conger, you're under arrest!
You've got nothing on me.
Oh no? Just moonshining, murder, giving whiskey to Indians... and a few other little things.
You can't prove any of those things and you wouldn't talk that way if you didn't have that gun.
[Whip holsters his gun]
You'll a murderer, Conger, and you're gonna hang for it, but first I have a score to settle for Gray Eagle...
[The Sheriff slugs Bob and the fight is on...]
[Jake discovers the villain's moonshine still]
Oh, lookee... Enough of that stuff to take a bath in!
When did you start bathing?
[Although their cabin is burning and full of smoke, the marshals pick off their attackers one by one]
I got him! There can't be many left out there.
Keep firing, Jake! Keep me covered! I'm going out after 'em.
Well, don't be too long. I don't want to be well-done.
[Bob and Jake capture the brains behind the renegade Indian attacks]
Doggone, if it ain't Mr. Welch!
Yes, Mr. Welch... renegade and murderer.
[last lines]
Hey, Jake, here comes your girlfriend!
[Mrs. Strongbow gives Jake a small box]
Now isn't that nice. She brought you a going-away present.
Thank you, Mrs. Strongbow. Thank you very much.
Well, aren't you going to open it?
Aw, in front of everybody?
Oh, come on. It might be a baked apple pie.
Oh, apple pie? Maybe some cheese with it...
[Jake opens the box and, to his digust, pulls out a razor]
